description: Myanmar Authorities place Sittwe, Rakhine state under partial lockdown starting from August 20, 2020.  Rakhine state, Sittwe, under a partial lockdown on Thursday, August 20, following the detection of six locally transmitted cases of the coronavirus disease  COVID-19  within four days. Lockdowns are in place in the Danyawaddy, Kone Tan, Myothagyi, and Ywartaunggyi quarters, where the cases were detected. Entry into these areas has been restricted until further notice. People are also required to wear a mask when traveling outside of homes. In addition, a number of flights operating between Sittwe Airport  AKY  Yangon International Airport  RGN  have been canceled for at least two weeks. The Yangon regional government has announced that it is planning to introduce a 21-day quarantine for those arriving from Sittwe.
